docTitle.titlePart: The Crystal Structures of BaSe2 and BaSe3

front.div:
BaSe2 crystallizes with a monoclinic cell, a = 9.820(5), 6 = 4.929(3), c = 9.335(5) A,
ß = 118.48(5)°; Z = 4, space group C 2/c. BaSe3 is tetragonal, o = 7.2802(5), c = 4.2495(4)
A; Z — 2, space group P42im. Both polyselenides are isotypic with the corresponding
polysulfides.
In the system Ba-S three polysulfides are known
